page.title: 10Farming in New Deer
page.content: Apart from the dairy units, most of the{farms}in this area are{mixed {livestock and arable farms.}The arable crops are often grown primarily to provide fodder for the animals. The main dairy animal is the {Friesian.}Beef cattle, apart from some{Aberdeen Angus,}are usually {crossbred}with a mixture of{Hereford, {Friesian, Charolais}or other type There are a number of{Pig units}and there are quite a number of{sheep kept on the land and some farmers have very busy lambing seasons. { Grass}is grown for direct{grazing and{silage}production, with only a small amount of{hay}being produced. {Winter barley, spring barley, Wheat, {Swede turnips, Oil Seed Rape}with its bright yellow flowers,{Potatoes,}some {Oats}and{Peas}are typical crops in this part of Buchan.
